home.heroTitle: Digital Evidentiary Preservation with Verifiable Chain of Custody
home.heroSubtitle: Technological infrastructure dedicated to the structured organization of digital assets with verifiable chain of custody, documented technical integrity and support for potential notarial formalization upon request by the holder.
home.introTitle: How to Preserve Digital Evidence with Legal Certainty
home.introP1: Digital evidentiary preservation consists of the structured and chronological organization of digital assets with potential legal relevance.
home.introP2: It operates preferably in the pre-litigation phase, structuring records before judicial, administrative or arbitral proceedings.
home.introP3: Admissibility of evidence remains subject to evaluation by the competent authority.
home.pillar1Desc: Structured chronological recording of all events related to the digital asset.
home.pillar2Desc: Technical mechanisms allowing future verification of integrity without exposing the content.
home.pillar3Desc: Possibility of notarial deed issuance based on previously preserved assets upon request.
home.h2Main: Technical Organization of Evidence with Evidentiary Validity
home.h2Secondary: Infrastructure Based on the Brazilian Code of Civil Procedure
home.home_applicability_desc: Digital evidentiary preservation may be used for judicial proceedings, administrative defenses, arbitration procedures, internal investigations and notarial formalizations.

preservation.title: How to Preserve Digital Evidence with Integrity and Documented Chain of Custody
preservation.p1: Preserving digital evidence requires technical mechanisms capable of chronologically and structurally recording events related to the asset.
preservation.p2: The digital chain of custody documents deposit, identifier generation and timestamp registration.
preservation.p3: Technical organization contributes to greater documentary clarity in proceedings.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis of Digital Evidence Preservation under Brazilian Law
legalBasis.p1: Brazilian law admits documentary evidence produced electronically provided its integrity and authenticity are demonstrated.
legalBasis.p2: Structured digital records may support the formation of judicial conviction.
legalBasis.p3: Formalization through notarial deed may reinforce chronological documentation.
legalBasis.h2Main: Legal Basis for Electronic Evidence Admissibility
legalBasis.h3CivilProcedure: Code of Civil Procedure — Arts. 369, 422 and 439

security.title: Integrity Architecture Applied to Digital Evidentiary Preservation
security.p1: Digital assets are protected by encryption and authentication mechanisms linked to the holder’s digital certificate.
security.p2: Preserved content is not accessible to third parties.
security.p3: Complementary integrity verification records may be generated without exposing content.
security.eNotarialDesc: Identity validation through the official Brazilian notary platform ensuring public faith.
security.nonRepudiationDesc: Mechanisms preventing denial of authorship or alteration.
security.encryptionDesc: High-standard encryption algorithms protecting assets during transmission and storage.
security.blockchainDesc: Distributed and immutable ledger ensuring traceability.
security.chainOfCustodyDesc: Complete and unalterable history of actions performed on each asset.
security.evidentialValidityDesc: Support for admissibility in administrative and judicial proceedings.
security.reliabilityDesc: Legal reliability depends on integrity, traceability and authorship control.
security.ctaDesc: Access the platform and explore our evidentiary preservation infrastructure.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: The process begins with the identification of the rights holder, which may involve notarial validation to reinforce legal security.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Following authentication, the digital asset is deposited and assigned a verifiable technical identifier.
howItWorks.step3Desc: All events become part of a structured chronological record documenting preservation.
howItWorks.step4Desc: Access remains restricted to the rights holder through authentication via digital certificate.
howItWorks.subtitle: A structured process for evidentiary preservation of digital assets with verifiable records.
howItWorks.processDescription: Tutela Digital® has developed a streamlined process that combines the usability of a modern digital platform with the legal rigor required to ensure the legal validity of custody. In four stages, you initiate the protection of your digital assets with public faith and an auditable chain of custody.
howItWorks.stepPlatformRegistrationDesc: Access the platform and complete your initial registration with basic identification information.
howItWorks.stepPlanSelectionDesc: Select the plan appropriate to your custody requirements and storage capacity needs.
howItWorks.stepNotaryInterviewDesc: Schedule and complete the interview with a notary public via the e-Notariado system for identity validation and public faith.
howItWorks.stepDepositAndRecordDesc: The digital asset undergoes technical integrity preservation mechanisms and timestamp registration, formally initiating its digital chain of custody.
howItWorks.legalValidityDesc: The admissibility of evidence is subject to review by the competent authority. The infrastructure ensures structured preservation and technical documentation of the digital asset.
howItWorks.ctaDesc: Access the platform and begin the protection process for your digital assets.
